word_mean: 〔复ova〕 卵，卵子：雌性的生殖细胞，受精后可发育成同种的一个新成员(von Baer，1827)
〔NA〕人卵，一种直径约0.1毫米的圆形细胞，产生于卵巢，在那里有一层非细胞性覆盖物沉积于它的周围(透明带，辐射带，它含有原浆，原浆中有一些卵黄，由一层薄的细胞膜包绕(卵黄膜)。它有一个很大的核(生发泡)，内有一个核仁(胚斑)。广义而言，该词也被用以指任何孕体的早期阶段，即胚胎本身只构成整个卵的极小部分时

sentence.Network_en: Once the ovum is released it has a lifespan of 12 to 36 hours.
sentence.Network_cn: 卵子排出后可存活12至36小时。

sentence.Network_en: By day 11 the ovum begins to attach and implant in the lining of the uterus.
sentence.Network_cn: 到第11天卵子着床嵌入子宫内壁.

sentence.Network_en: One pc of germ cell approaches to a ovum quietly at first.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个精子一马当先悄悄接近卵子.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: from Latin, literally egg'

entry.def: An ovum is one of the eggs of a woman or female animal.

example.ex: Once the ovum is released it has a lifespan of 12 to 36 hours.
example.tran: 卵子排出后可存活12至36小时。

means.word_mean: 1. the female reproductive cell; the female gamete
